title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics defeat the Magic 111-107, splitting their two-game series in Orlando.
Luka Garza contributes 16 points and 8 rebounds off the bench, key to Celtics' victory.
Jordan Walsh's defense helps limit Magic's Franz Wagner, while contributing crucial late-game points.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain the Red Sox's game-planning and run prevention coach for the 2026 season.
After 28 years with the Red Sox, Varitek opted to stay despite exploring potential managerial openings elsewhere.
Varitek praised Boston's young roster, highlighting catcher Carlos Narvaez's strong performance and potential as a key team contributor.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson scored three touchdowns, leading Patriots to a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams and Henderson combined for 222 of New England's 435 total yards, showcasing explosive playmaking against Tampa Bay.
Rookie defensive players Woodson and Ponder contributed significantly, with critical tackles and a sack aiding Patriots’ defense.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is the current frontrunner for NFL MVP according to FanDuel and other major oddsmakers.
Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns in the Patriots' 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Maye has a completion rate of 71.7% with 2,555 passing yards, 19 touchdowns, and 5 interceptions this season.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract with the Patriots to officially retire as a member of the team.
Gronkowski is one of the top tight ends ever, holding the Patriots' record for career receiving touchdowns with 79.
Gronkowski played nine seasons with the Patriots, winning three Super Bowls, before joining the Buccaneers for two seasons.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams scored key touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Drake Maye's performance was mixed, with a season-low 51% completion rate, but resulted in crucial plays for the Patriots.
Patriots' tight ends were ineffective with minimal catches, while Christian Barmore struggled with only one tackle in the game.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots extended their win streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams combined for three touchdowns, contributing 222 of the Patriots' 435 total yards.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 16-of-31 passes for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception during the game.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, charged with DUI after allegedly crashing into a pole at Leverett Circle, October 19.
Daveiga pleaded not guilty to DUI and other charges; released on personal recognizance after Oct. 20 arraignment.
Officer placed on modified duty pending legal proceedings; incident reported to Massachusetts POST Commission.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: ICE detained nine Allston Car Wash workers on November 4 despite work permits, raising legal and custody concerns.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reported difficulty obtaining information about detainees, some of whom alleged mistreatment in custody.
Officials claim detainees entered the U.S. illegally; local leaders and families decry the raid as unjust and support legal aid.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on November 8, 2025, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser, who rose to fame in 2024, previously hosted the Golden Globes and roasted at NFL honors.
The episode featured Glaser's monologue, Sombr's performances, and Pete Davidson on 'Weekend Update.'
